title: How to Have Fun With an Air Gun

steps.headline: Learn how to load, cock, and fire your air gun safely.
steps.description: Having an accident with your air gun will eliminate your chance to have fun with it.

steps.headline: Find a suitable space for the following steps where you know stray BBs will not cause damage to anything or injure anyone.
Try to hit a target or piece of paper from 25 feet (7.6 m) away.
steps.description: You can use manufactured targets, or you can make your own with paper and a marker.

steps.headline: Try to hit a picture printed off of the internet.
steps.description: Look for anything you want to shoot at on the internet, whether it is big game animals, dinosaurs, aircraft, or even aliens.

steps.headline: Make a moving target to shoot at by hanging a line from a tree or pole in your shooting area, then tying a target so it swings like a pendulum in front of you.
Try to hit the "A" on a playing card.
steps.description: You can even have a friend toss the card in the air for you, but be careful to only shoot when you know the card is in a safe location as it flies.

steps.headline: Blow up balloons, or make water balloons and try to pop them with the air gun.
steps.description: Cheap balloons are better, especially for low-powered air guns, since pellets and BBs can bounce off of heavy duty balloons.

steps.headline: Use clothes pins to attach targets to a string stretched tightly.
steps.description: When you hit the target, it should spin on the line.

steps.headline: Make two dimensional or three dimensional targets to practice on.
Have contests with friends to see who can hit the most targets while scores are kept.

text:
Learn how to load, cock, and fire your air gun safely. Having an accident with your air gun will eliminate your chance to have fun with it. Find a suitable space for the following steps where you know stray BBs will not cause damage to anything or injure anyone. The first step to safely shooting an air gun is to make sure you know what is behind your target. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/53/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid267307-v4-728px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The next step is to make sure BBs or pellets will not bounce off any surface and hit you. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/77/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/aid267307-v4-728px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Next, make sure you have eye protection when shooting your air gun. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/7c/Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/aid267307-v4-728px-Have-Fun-With-an-Air-Gun-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Try to hit a target or piece of paper from 25 feet (7.6 m) away. You can use manufactured targets, or you can make your own with paper and a marker. Try to hit a picture printed off of the internet. Look for anything you want to shoot at on the internet, whether it is big game animals, dinosaurs, aircraft, or even aliens. Make a moving target to shoot at by hanging a line from a tree or pole in your shooting area, then tying a target so it swings like a pendulum in front of you. Try to hit the "A" on a playing card. You can even have a friend toss the card in the air for you, but be careful to only shoot when you know the card is in a safe location as it flies. Blow up balloons, or make water balloons and try to pop them with the air gun. Cheap balloons are better, especially for low-powered air guns, since pellets and BBs can bounce off of heavy duty balloons. Use clothes pins to attach targets to a string stretched tightly. When you hit the target, it should spin on the line. Make two dimensional or three dimensional targets to practice on. Have contests with friends to see who can hit the most targets while scores are kept.
